definitions.definition: A substance that is harmful or lethal to a living organism.
definitions.example: We used a poison to kill the weeds.

definitions.definition: Something that harms a person or thing.

definitions.example: — I'll have a glass of whisky.

definitions.definition: Any substance that inhibits catalytic activity.
To use poison to kill or paralyse (somebody).
To pollute; to cause to become poisonous.
definitions.example: That factory is poisoning the river.

definitions.definition: To cause to become much worse.
definitions.example: He poisoned the mood in the room with his non-stop criticism.

definitions.definition: To cause (someone) to hate or to have unfair negative opinions.
definitions.example: She's poisoned him against all his old friends.

definitions.definition: To inhibit the catalytic activity of.
To place false information into (a cache) as part of an exploit.
